details.address: 618 W Franklin Blvd Suite D, Gastonia, NC 28052

raw_data.address: 618 W Franklin Blvd Suite D, Gastonia, NC 28052
raw_data.name: Waterbean Coffee Exquisite

reviews_data.review_text: Beautiful coffee stop with great coffee.

I am truly excited for a beautiful coffee bar in Gastonia. The atmosphere is nice. The place is beautiful however, I think the service is not organized. I think they should have a number system when you order and they should have someone on the floor to bring you out the food. I literally sat at a table that was dirty. There was many used cups all over the bar there was no one there to clean up. It was my first time it just might be a fluke maybe somebody didn’t come in, but somebody should’ve been cleaning up after the customers. The food was good. We had sandwiches s and they were great. The coffee is excellent. I highly recommend it just this one thing they could fix and it’ll be a five star.

I like the atmosphere here. I ordered a brown sugar latte, syrup was good but I think it could have less, it was too sweet. I think for as nice of a place as it is you should be bringing customers their drinks instead of calling them back up to the counter, especially when it’s slow
Good and drinks were was really dissatisfied that the drinks I ordered did not come in dining glass as I expected from advertised photos. Instead they came in plastic Togo glasses

Jacob was an excellent barista! He was very kind, taking time to talk with my husband and I and making sure our drinks were delicious. The presentation was spot on. Clean, beautiful and quiet atmosphere. So glad we decided to have our coffee inside instead of taking it to go!
Beautiful shop. Plenty of seating extremely clean staff was wonderful.

I’ve now had the same issue twice with online ordering, and it’s really disappointing. I order ahead through the app specifically because I’m on my way to work and need to grab my drink quickly.

Both times, I placed my order 25–30 minutes in advance, but when I arrived, my order hadn’t even been checked on their system. Today the café wasn’t busy (only a few tables occupied), and I could see my order still sitting unchecked on the tablet while staff were making drinks for walk-in customers. One staff member was even sitting idle.

If online orders aren’t going to be monitored or prioritized, then the app shouldn’t be taking orders. The whole point of ordering ahead is convenience and saving time. Instead, I’m being asked to wait another 20–30 minutes after arriving.

Really frustrating experience for customers who are on a schedule.
The best place where you can get a quiet corner with the greatest coffeeee ☕️, the stuff are awesome!!!!!
Very unique design, really cosy place.

I simply stopped in for a cup of coffee. I was pleased with the coffee I received. However, my biggest problem is that the restaurant does not offer any handicap parking. None at all. I was lucky to find a spot upfront, but I really will think twice before going back because it’s difficult to park.
It's a beautiful space that makes a coffee date feel special.  I love trying their different matcha specials.

Best coffee ☕
Great atmosphere
Lox and Bagel were fabulous!  Salted caramel coffee was amazing! A great place for a Sunday brunch or meeting space.
Super groovy and I love the fact that it's open late
Beautiful space. I love the piano! It's bright plenty of seating friendly service.

The staff is so friendly and makes you feel at home as soon as you walk in the door.  The decor in this location is top tier making it feel like you've stepped into a fancy coffeehouse. When I am here I forget I am in Gastonia.

Fancy appearance, chill staff, EXCELLENT pricing. you’d think they would charge more but they charged only $6.95 for a cappuccino. They have liquor too, also great pricing. this is one of the only nice places in Gastonia.

Muy hermoso el lugar, y buen precio. Café y batido muy rico con tostadas 😋. Fuimos 5 y nos gastamos 80$. Ambiente acogedor, perfecto para compartir un buen rato con tu pareja con amigos.

Me encantó. Y sobretodo muy buena atención. Lo recomiendo 👍

Waterbean Coffee is truly exquisite. The atmosphere is incredibly relaxing and peaceful. I visited on New Year’s Day and spent time listening to a coaching call on my tablet—it was the perfect calm environment to focus and unwind.

The food was excellent. I ordered the avocado toast with lettuce and tomato, along with a hot latte with sugar-free hazelnut, and everything was absolutely delicious.

Customer service was outstanding as well. The gentleman that took my order and was very patient, friendly, and welcoming, which made the experience even better.
Overall, a wonderful visit. I will definitely be back!
Great place to come in and do some work or just hang out.

Really great place to check out whether you go alone or with a group! Their coffee and their sandwiches are both delicious. I had to stop myself from going back inside to get more French macarons. The inside is lovely, service is laid-back, and prices are about the same in comparison with other coffee shops in the area.
So excited to have this place in Gastonia! Lattes are incredible and the bagels (gotta get the waterbean sauce) are so good. Really pretty atmosphere and chill vibes 😊

Good service, good coffee, good atmosphere.
I see some people leaving less than good reviews because the few baristas didnt spoon feed them their coffee, but in the review we see pictures of a room full of guests... I guess some of the more entitled folk cannot be pleased...
Thank you Waterbean for doing a great job, AND carrying a smile even with the annoying customers.
Cream cheese bagel, ribeye sandwich, mango smoothie are good
Excellent place

The coffee was disgusting. I ordered a latte but practically got a cup of milk and syrup, way too sweet and couldn't taste any coffee at all. It also had a very strange flavor to it that gave me a stomachache. The customer service was unhelpful, there wasnno music playing so it was all very awkward and silent. Please put felt ends on the bar chairs so that they don't squeak so loudly when trying to pull the chair back to sit. The space is so large and empty that the sound echoes. Also, please don't put plant vases on grand pianos, the moisture and condensation can actually destroy the piano and alter its sound permanently. For all the money you spent on a grand piano, please make sure to take good care of it. Clearly, the piano is meant as a decoration and not as an instrument. And, I'm still not over how disgusting my coffee was. What a waste of $12
Excellent experience for coffee, decor and custom service. Will be back for more
Highly recommend the ribeye sandwich. Smoothies were delicious, service was nice.

Bright space with seriously comfy chairs and extremely friendly staff. I ordered the gluten-free, vegan pumpkin muffin (warmed upon suggestion ✅)and a toffee nut latte with macadamia milk. Truly a luxurious feeling in Gastonia.

I recently visited this coffee shop after my brother highly recommended. While the décor is undeniably beautiful and gives off a very fancy, inviting vibe, the overall experience fell short. The customer service wasn’t great — it felt a bit inattentive and rude, which took away from what could have been a really nice visit.

The food also wasn’t particularly impressive. I ordered a pumpkin spice latte, but unfortunately the pumpkin flavor was basically missing. It tasted more like a regular latte than anything seasonal or special.

Overall, it’s a lovely place to look at, but the service and flavors need improvement for me to want to return.
Absolutely wonderful sliced rib eye sandwich and coffee.

The coffee and food is nice but the service is so bad I can't recommend it.

The first time we went, we waited an hour and never got our food. They lost the ticket. At that point we needed to leave. We were told only the owner could authorize a refund and they weren't there so we'd have to come back. We decided not to make a fuss over $25 and just let it go.

We waited a few weeks before going back, thinking they just opened and needed to work out the kinks.

We went in again recently and ordered 4 drinks and 3 food items. It was over 40 minutes and things came out one at a time. By the time the last member of our party got their coffee, everyone else had either finished or their drink had gone cold.

It was a very disappointing trip, maybe we'll give it another try in a few months time but it won't be my regular coffee spot.

Food, drinks and service are all fantastic! Wonderful and quiet atmosphere. Overall a great place to get together with friends and family for a bite to eat or a quick coffee to go. They had a lot more than I anticipated walking in for the first time such as macarons, cookies and ice cream! Will definitely be coming back.
Giving 5 stares to offset the other dumb reviews.
Food was great coffee latte frappe came out with spillage over the sides made for sticky fingers. Our first visit was ok besides food and muffin came out before drinks.
Customer service great each time food cooked great atmosphere wonderful

I’d driven by this place many times without thinking much of it, but decided to give it a try after a friend’s recommendation and I’m so glad I did. There’s no drive-thru, but that’s part of the charm. The interior is absolutely gorgeous—such a great throwback to what coffee shops used to be before they turned into waiting areas for to-go orders. It’s the perfect spot to relax, read, or get some work done in a beautiful, comfortable setting. The creativity and variety in their drink offerings are awesome, too!
This is the best looking place for coffee in Carolina with graceful decorations.

Was looking forward to this location opening for over a year. Upon my first visit, I was impressed by the decor but when I went to order I immediately noticed there was zero effort from the cashier. They don't greet you with a "hello" or "good morning" or "hi, what can i get for you" at least? Just them standing there while I made my order. No eye contact, or the feeling that they want to be there or even that I be there. After I made my order I said "thank you" and did not even get an acknowledgement. For a plain bagel and a latte I waited at least 10 minutes to be called to grab it.....The vibes were just off.

On my second visit I dined in, had the same awkward experience with the same cashier. That has confirmed for me it wasn't a one-off experience but that is quite literally that person's attitude. I'm not sure how long they'll have the same cashiers on staff but I won't be recommending this cafe to anyone or returning until they get their customer service in order.
It was such a wonderful experience, from customer service to the breakfast.very decent and clean environment 👌

So happy this is open in Gastonia! Came for the first time Saturday morning and returned the following day! I loved the coffee, food, atmosphere, and service. It’s already got a great crowd and nice vibe. Super excited for this place and what it will bring to the neighborhood. It’s cool they offer all day food options and even wine/beer/cocktails and looks like ice cream too.

Beautiful building, Coffee is fine, service is, as you would expect from a fancy coffee place, not great.  Plenty of seating, but they did not do counter/table service.  So you wait in line, order your  coffee and then wait for them to call your name...even if you're sitting right next to where they make it.  🤔
This place is gorgeous! Staff is friendly, food and coffee was amazing! Can't wait to sign up for one of their classes! Highly recommend!

I was excited for this place but was a bit disappointed.

I got a classic macchiato and it had the same issues I always get at the Belmont location - sour espresso and poorly steamed milk. You can tell in my pictures that the milk has large, soapy air bubbles that aren't smooth and popped almost instantly, leaving me with just a milky drink instead of a fluffy, steamed milk drink. It didn't taste good either, very sour. I can make a better macchiato at home with my hand grinder and $100 espresso machine. They really need to get someone in here and the Belmont location to do a shot-pulling and milk steaming workshop.

On the plus side, it is a really nice place. Cool interior, comfortable chairs, and a lot of space - it's a good spot to work. The bar is really cool and reminds me of a Starbucks Reserve, which is awesome that we have a place like this in Gastonia. The AI art decorations were a bit of a let down, though.

Like at the Belmont location, Waterbean is great if you like flavored drinks - their syrups are high quality and they make some interesting and delicious "fancy" drinks. Definitely not the place to get espresso-heavy drinks (shot/cappuccino/cortado/etc) though, unless you like them sour and poorly-steamed. It's way too expensive for bad espresso :(
Super beautiful place really enjoyed the coffee and the food very peaceful place

TL;DR the coffee and food are amazing, not necessarily family friendly

I have been so excited for this location to open! I have been following the instagram page since it launched waiting for the launch date. I was able to try it today with my family. The pumpkin spice latte was great, and the breakfast sandwich I got was so, so good. This location is quite large and has plenty of seating.

I went with my two children (a baby & toddler). Let me preface, I am not a ‘gentle parent’ but expect my toddler to behave with respect, especially when we are in public. It was very quiet when we entered, so I make a strong effort to keep the toddler chill (as chill as a toddler can be!). Genuinely trying my best to teach my child to be respectful and kind to others. I received several dirty looks from customers & even had an employee refuse to make eye contact with me when asking for a to go cup. It was just a weird experience that I haven’t had before in other stores.

I say all this just to say I got the impression it is a fancy, vibey, child-free environment. Would go back to work by myself, would not bring my kids again.
Prices were actually reasonable and the food/coffee was great. I personally would take my children but not necessarily  unfriendly for kiddos.

⭐☆☆☆☆ — Beautiful Café, Poor Service Experience at Waterbean Coffee (Gastonia)
I recently visited Waterbean Coffee in Gastonia for the first time, and while the café itself is absolutely beautiful, the experience was very disappointing overall. The décor and atmosphere were lovely, but the service and attention to detail were far below expectations.

When ordering, the cashier seemed overwhelmed but tried her best despite a long, constant line. I ordered a large coffee and asked if they could make it “light and sweet” with six creams and six sugars. I was told they had half and half, which I agreed to use. My partner ordered a tea, and we both ordered croissant sandwiches to go.

Our name was called three separate times, which was confusing for a to-go order. The first drink was served in a mug instead of a to-go cup, and when we corrected it, the blonde barista behind the counter seemed frustrated but transferred it into a paper cup. Everyone dining in had mugs with plates, yet ours came without — small detail, but it stood out.

The second drink came unlabeled and in the wrong-sized cup. We only knew which was which after opening them. Thankfully, a kind gentleman working in the kitchen area noticed and helped make things right — the only staff member who seemed genuinely kind and attentive. However, when the second drink was fixed, it came back in a white cup covered in stains and splashes. The coffee tasted bitter and unpleasant, and the cup was filled to the rim with no room to add cream or sugar. This was frustrating since I’d specifically asked for my coffee to be prepared at the front. Instead, I ended up making it myself at the back station.

What bothered me most was the inconsistent and sometimes unfriendly customer service. The barista behind the counter seemed selective in how she treated guests — giving plates and extra care to some while being dismissive to others. One of the most upsetting moments was seeing a disabled man politely ask for a to-go plate. Instead of helping or asking someone else to, she told him to “wave the woman down” when she came out of the kitchen. That was disappointing to witness.

When our food finally arrived (after our name was called for the third time), the croissant sandwiches were delicious — hot, fresh, and full of flavor with a great house sauce. The food was honestly the best part of the entire visit. However, again, the sandwiches weren’t labeled, so we had to open them to see which was which.

I also noticed some kitchen staff with long hair not wearing hairnets. As someone who’s worked in customer service and food service for over 20 years — and as a licensed cosmetologist trained in sanitation — I can say that proper food safety practices are important. Hairnets should be mandatory when preparing food.

Overall, the café felt understaffed and unorganized. The cashier was struggling, the counter worker was overwhelmed, and the kitchen staff seemed under pressure. The space is beautiful and has great potential, but the service and quality control need serious improvement.

Suggestions for improvement:
Serve all drinks from one order together
Label drinks and food items clearly
Ensure cups are clean before serving
Provide consistent, friendly customer service
Add more front-of-house staff to help during rush hours
Require name tags and hairnets for all employees
Improve organization and workflow

It’s disappointing because I’ve been a loyal Waterbean Coffee customer in Charlotte for years and have always had great experiences there. Unfortunately, this Gastonia location did not meet the same standard. The food was great, the drinks were mediocre, and the service was poor.

For such a beautiful and seemingly upscale place, I expected better. Customer service is everything, and I truly hope management takes steps to improve. I might give it another try in the future, but based on this visit, it was not the relaxing or enjoyable morning we had hoped for.

This was our 2nd trip to Waterbean. I ordered a pumpkin Stove Latte with whole milk. My wife asked if they could make the Snickerdoodle with Oat Milk and make it hot and they said they could. The Pumpkin Spice came out first. It tasted like hot milk. I couldn't tell there was any coffee in it and the "pumpkin spice" also tasted weird. They didn't tell us which drink they have is, so as we asked and they told us it was the Pumpkin Spice, my wife noticed that the barista was making a child drink. She said, "Of that's the Snickerdoodle, it's suppose to be hot with Oat Milk". (She is lactose intolerant). They said, "Oh. Hot? Do you want the cold foam on top? My wife said, "Is it made with Oat Milk?" They said, "No, but without the cold foam it's just white mocha, because we put the flavoring on top of the cold foam". So, she opted for a Pumpkin Spice Latte. I had not said anything about the fact that I didn't care for mine. When she got hers she said, "It's watery. I didn't even taste any coffee". I then ordered for "2 separate espresso shots" to add to our lattes. They brought me a double shot in one cup. Ok, so we split it and added it to our lattes. My wife said, "This tastes like muddy water out of an old boot". They just weren't good, no matter what we did. I really, really wanted to support them and I want them to be successful, but I can say that we won't be back. Makes me sad.  The place is beautiful and maybe their cocktails are good.
Amazing coffee and good food. Food took a bit to come out, but they were busy, so it's expected.

Everything was super good food and coffee ! Communication needs to be worked on . We waited 3 hours for our food to arrive. She kept coming back and forth asking what we ordered and on the 4th we got frustrated because people after us keep getting there food. Need more ppl in the kitchen or more communication

The place is pretty busy with being new and I understand the food may take some time due to working out kinks but the vibe, food, and coffee is truly exquisite! Definitely recommend and it’s a welcome addition to Gastonia!

This location is very nice of course but I have to say that the coffee is nothing special, I would pick Panera a Starbucks etc over this place any day.,. I feel horrible to have to say this but I have to be honest McDonald's frappes and coffee is even a hundred times better. All that we got were two frappes a bagel with cream cheese and a croissant and waited for 55 minutes and this was after the rush on Saturday morning we paid for our items at 11:56 and did not walk out the door until 12: 55. Yes the atmosphere is beautiful and you can tell that someone put money into the interior / exterior but that doesn't make the coffee or the food taste any better I did ask for a toasted bagel and all I got was a warm bagel. My husband got a Dubai croissant (chocolate croissant) he did like that.,.. we live in the Trenton Mill apartments right behind the coffee shop and probably will not go back... I do understand that they did just open 2 weeks ago and they are trying to get everything figured out but as far as the quality I'm not impressed and waiting an hour for a bagel and croissant seemed a little much.. especially that the rush was already over with.
Not to mention it was right at $30 for two frappes a bagel with cream cheese and a croissant. Great job on the decor!!

I would wait to visit. We waited over an hour and a half for food. Tasted decent but little to no communication on what to expect and only compensated us for one drink after I said something. People who got here long after us were served before us. Very frustrating

Took my mother to the grand opening last Saturday. Live music (piano) and ambiance were incredible! Menu options and decor were first class. Thank you for choosing West Gastonia. I will be a repeat customer.
Came yesterday between church services was very impressed.   Came this morning with wife and kids.  Wonderful breakfast and coffee.

Great coffee with multiple bean options!
Can’t wait to come back and try different things

Stopped by the grand opening of Waterbean Coffee in Gastonia — great turnout and tons of energy in the place. The building and interior are absolutely beautiful, with a clean and modern feel that really stands out. It did take about an hour to get our drinks (they were definitely slammed with the crowd), but the staff was friendly and working hard to keep up. The live piano was a nice touch, though it was a bit too loud to hold a conversation. Overall, a great addition to Gastonia and looking forward to coming back once things settle down!
Not sure why making my cappuccino required the use of a blow torch, but I'm intrigued. Great addition to the neighborhood.

I waited all week to get here and we were the first people to arrive. It has a great ambience, there's a piano in the corner, however I didn't get to take a picture of it yet; as well as the gold accentuated seats and accents. They have a private room that I believe you can rent that looks really well, also they had matcha lattes. It was delicious and I had the pumpkin white mocha latte hot, it was just as delicious and just for general purposes I ordered a ribeye sandwich. I prefer ribeye with onion and mayo but this had provolone cheese and some type of glaze on it. It wasn't nasty it was different than what I expected but it was well done and it even looked very good. Abigail, Aniston, Elena, and Amaya (hope I spelled their names correctly) we're hospitable, kind, audible and professional. I recommend to come here early morning if you pass by here on your way to work or even on your way home. It has a great ambience to it, I love the music they were playing, overall refreshing. Thank you for joining the community.

raw_data.address: 618 W Franklin Blvd Suite D, Gastonia, NC 28052
raw_data.name: Waterbean Coffee Exquisite

reviews_data.review_text: Beautiful coffee stop with great coffee.

I am truly excited for a beautiful coffee bar in Gastonia. The atmosphere is nice. The place is beautiful however, I think the service is not organized. I think they should have a number system when you order and they should have someone on the floor to bring you out the food. I literally sat at a table that was dirty. There was many used cups all over the bar there was no one there to clean up. It was my first time it just might be a fluke maybe somebody didn’t come in, but somebody should’ve been cleaning up after the customers. The food was good. We had sandwiches s and they were great. The coffee is excellent. I highly recommend it just this one thing they could fix and it’ll be a five star.

I like the atmosphere here. I ordered a brown sugar latte, syrup was good but I think it could have less, it was too sweet. I think for as nice of a place as it is you should be bringing customers their drinks instead of calling them back up to the counter, especially when it’s slow

Jacob was an excellent barista! He was very kind, taking time to talk with my husband and I and making sure our drinks were delicious. The presentation was spot on. Clean, beautiful and quiet atmosphere. So glad we decided to have our coffee inside instead of taking it to go!
Beautiful shop. Plenty of seating extremely clean staff was wonderful.

I’ve now had the same issue twice with online ordering, and it’s really disappointing. I order ahead through the app specifically because I’m on my way to work and need to grab my drink quickly.

Both times, I placed my order 25–30 minutes in advance, but when I arrived, my order hadn’t even been checked on their system. Today the café wasn’t busy (only a few tables occupied), and I could see my order still sitting unchecked on the tablet while staff were making drinks for walk-in customers. One staff member was even sitting idle.

If online orders aren’t going to be monitored or prioritized, then the app shouldn’t be taking orders. The whole point of ordering ahead is convenience and saving time. Instead, I’m being asked to wait another 20–30 minutes after arriving.

Really frustrating experience for customers who are on a schedule.
The best place where you can get a quiet corner with the greatest coffeeee ☕️, the stuff are awesome!!!!!
Very unique design, really cosy place.

I simply stopped in for a cup of coffee. I was pleased with the coffee I received. However, my biggest problem is that the restaurant does not offer any handicap parking. None at all. I was lucky to find a spot upfront, but I really will think twice before going back because it’s difficult to park.
It's a beautiful space that makes a coffee date feel special.  I love trying their different matcha specials.

Best coffee ☕
Great atmosphere
Lox and Bagel were fabulous!  Salted caramel coffee was amazing! A great place for a Sunday brunch or meeting space.
Super groovy and I love the fact that it's open late
Beautiful space. I love the piano! It's bright plenty of seating friendly service.

The staff is so friendly and makes you feel at home as soon as you walk in the door.  The decor in this location is top tier making it feel like you've stepped into a fancy coffeehouse. When I am here I forget I am in Gastonia.

Fancy appearance, chill staff, EXCELLENT pricing. you’d think they would charge more but they charged only $6.95 for a cappuccino. They have liquor too, also great pricing. this is one of the only nice places in Gastonia.

The food was excellent. I ordered the avocado toast with lettuce and tomato, along with a hot latte with sugar-free hazelnut, and everything was absolutely delicious.

Customer service was outstanding as well. The gentleman that took my order and was very patient, friendly, and welcoming, which made the experience even better.
Overall, a wonderful visit. I will definitely be back!
Great place to come in and do some work or just hang out.

Really great place to check out whether you go alone or with a group! Their coffee and their sandwiches are both delicious. I had to stop myself from going back inside to get more French macarons. The inside is lovely, service is laid-back, and prices are about the same in comparison with other coffee shops in the area.
So excited to have this place in Gastonia! Lattes are incredible and the bagels (gotta get the waterbean sauce) are so good. Really pretty atmosphere and chill vibes 😊

Good service, good coffee, good atmosphere.
I see some people leaving less than good reviews because the few baristas didnt spoon feed them their coffee, but in the review we see pictures of a room full of guests... I guess some of the more entitled folk cannot be pleased...
Thank you Waterbean for doing a great job, AND carrying a smile even with the annoying customers.
Cream cheese bagel, ribeye sandwich, mango smoothie are good
Excellent place

The coffee was disgusting. I ordered a latte but practically got a cup of milk and syrup, way too sweet and couldn't taste any coffee at all. It also had a very strange flavor to it that gave me a stomachache. The customer service was unhelpful, there wasnno music playing so it was all very awkward and silent. Please put felt ends on the bar chairs so that they don't squeak so loudly when trying to pull the chair back to sit. The space is so large and empty that the sound echoes. Also, please don't put plant vases on grand pianos, the moisture and condensation can actually destroy the piano and alter its sound permanently. For all the money you spent on a grand piano, please make sure to take good care of it. Clearly, the piano is meant as a decoration and not as an instrument. And, I'm still not over how disgusting my coffee was. What a waste of $12
Excellent experience for coffee, decor and custom service. Will be back for more
Highly recommend the ribeye sandwich. Smoothies were delicious, service was nice.

Bright space with seriously comfy chairs and extremely friendly staff. I ordered the gluten-free, vegan pumpkin muffin (warmed upon suggestion ✅)and a toffee nut latte with macadamia milk. Truly a luxurious feeling in Gastonia.

I recently visited this coffee shop after my brother highly recommended. While the décor is undeniably beautiful and gives off a very fancy, inviting vibe, the overall experience fell short. The customer service wasn’t great — it felt a bit inattentive and rude, which took away from what could have been a really nice visit.

The food also wasn’t particularly impressive. I ordered a pumpkin spice latte, but unfortunately the pumpkin flavor was basically missing. It tasted more like a regular latte than anything seasonal or special.

Overall, it’s a lovely place to look at, but the service and flavors need improvement for me to want to return.
Absolutely wonderful sliced rib eye sandwich and coffee.

The coffee and food is nice but the service is so bad I can't recommend it.

The first time we went, we waited an hour and never got our food. They lost the ticket. At that point we needed to leave. We were told only the owner could authorize a refund and they weren't there so we'd have to come back. We decided not to make a fuss over $25 and just let it go.

We waited a few weeks before going back, thinking they just opened and needed to work out the kinks.

We went in again recently and ordered 4 drinks and 3 food items. It was over 40 minutes and things came out one at a time. By the time the last member of our party got their coffee, everyone else had either finished or their drink had gone cold.

It was a very disappointing trip, maybe we'll give it another try in a few months time but it won't be my regular coffee spot.

Food, drinks and service are all fantastic! Wonderful and quiet atmosphere. Overall a great place to get together with friends and family for a bite to eat or a quick coffee to go. They had a lot more than I anticipated walking in for the first time such as macarons, cookies and ice cream! Will definitely be coming back.
Giving 5 stares to offset the other dumb reviews.
Food was great coffee latte frappe came out with spillage over the sides made for sticky fingers. Our first visit was ok besides food and muffin came out before drinks.
Customer service great each time food cooked great atmosphere wonderful

I’d driven by this place many times without thinking much of it, but decided to give it a try after a friend’s recommendation and I’m so glad I did. There’s no drive-thru, but that’s part of the charm. The interior is absolutely gorgeous—such a great throwback to what coffee shops used to be before they turned into waiting areas for to-go orders. It’s the perfect spot to relax, read, or get some work done in a beautiful, comfortable setting. The creativity and variety in their drink offerings are awesome, too!
This is the best looking place for coffee in Carolina with graceful decorations.

Was looking forward to this location opening for over a year. Upon my first visit, I was impressed by the decor but when I went to order I immediately noticed there was zero effort from the cashier. They don't greet you with a "hello" or "good morning" or "hi, what can i get for you" at least? Just them standing there while I made my order. No eye contact, or the feeling that they want to be there or even that I be there. After I made my order I said "thank you" and did not even get an acknowledgement. For a plain bagel and a latte I waited at least 10 minutes to be called to grab it.....The vibes were just off.

On my second visit I dined in, had the same awkward experience with the same cashier. That has confirmed for me it wasn't a one-off experience but that is quite literally that person's attitude. I'm not sure how long they'll have the same cashiers on staff but I won't be recommending this cafe to anyone or returning until they get their customer service in order.
It was such a wonderful experience, from customer service to the breakfast.very decent and clean environment 👌

So happy this is open in Gastonia! Came for the first time Saturday morning and returned the following day! I loved the coffee, food, atmosphere, and service. It’s already got a great crowd and nice vibe. Super excited for this place and what it will bring to the neighborhood. It’s cool they offer all day food options and even wine/beer/cocktails and looks like ice cream too.

Beautiful building, Coffee is fine, service is, as you would expect from a fancy coffee place, not great.  Plenty of seating, but they did not do counter/table service.  So you wait in line, order your  coffee and then wait for them to call your name...even if you're sitting right next to where they make it.  🤔
This place is gorgeous! Staff is friendly, food and coffee was amazing! Can't wait to sign up for one of their classes! Highly recommend!

I was excited for this place but was a bit disappointed.

I got a classic macchiato and it had the same issues I always get at the Belmont location - sour espresso and poorly steamed milk. You can tell in my pictures that the milk has large, soapy air bubbles that aren't smooth and popped almost instantly, leaving me with just a milky drink instead of a fluffy, steamed milk drink. It didn't taste good either, very sour. I can make a better macchiato at home with my hand grinder and $100 espresso machine. They really need to get someone in here and the Belmont location to do a shot-pulling and milk steaming workshop.

On the plus side, it is a really nice place. Cool interior, comfortable chairs, and a lot of space - it's a good spot to work. The bar is really cool and reminds me of a Starbucks Reserve, which is awesome that we have a place like this in Gastonia. The AI art decorations were a bit of a let down, though.

Like at the Belmont location, Waterbean is great if you like flavored drinks - their syrups are high quality and they make some interesting and delicious "fancy" drinks. Definitely not the place to get espresso-heavy drinks (shot/cappuccino/cortado/etc) though, unless you like them sour and poorly-steamed. It's way too expensive for bad espresso :(
Super beautiful place really enjoyed the coffee and the food very peaceful place

TL;DR the coffee and food are amazing, not necessarily family friendly

I have been so excited for this location to open! I have been following the instagram page since it launched waiting for the launch date. I was able to try it today with my family. The pumpkin spice latte was great, and the breakfast sandwich I got was so, so good. This location is quite large and has plenty of seating.

I went with my two children (a baby & toddler). Let me preface, I am not a ‘gentle parent’ but expect my toddler to behave with respect, especially when we are in public. It was very quiet when we entered, so I make a strong effort to keep the toddler chill (as chill as a toddler can be!). Genuinely trying my best to teach my child to be respectful and kind to others. I received several dirty looks from customers & even had an employee refuse to make eye contact with me when asking for a to go cup. It was just a weird experience that I haven’t had before in other stores.

I say all this just to say I got the impression it is a fancy, vibey, child-free environment. Would go back to work by myself, would not bring my kids again.
Prices were actually reasonable and the food/coffee was great. I personally would take my children but not necessarily  unfriendly for kiddos.

⭐☆☆☆☆ — Beautiful Café, Poor Service Experience at Waterbean Coffee (Gastonia)
I recently visited Waterbean Coffee in Gastonia for the first time, and while the café itself is absolutely beautiful, the experience was very disappointing overall. The décor and atmosphere were lovely, but the service and attention to detail were far below expectations.

When ordering, the cashier seemed overwhelmed but tried her best despite a long, constant line. I ordered a large coffee and asked if they could make it “light and sweet” with six creams and six sugars. I was told they had half and half, which I agreed to use. My partner ordered a tea, and we both ordered croissant sandwiches to go.

Our name was called three separate times, which was confusing for a to-go order. The first drink was served in a mug instead of a to-go cup, and when we corrected it, the blonde barista behind the counter seemed frustrated but transferred it into a paper cup. Everyone dining in had mugs with plates, yet ours came without — small detail, but it stood out.

The second drink came unlabeled and in the wrong-sized cup. We only knew which was which after opening them. Thankfully, a kind gentleman working in the kitchen area noticed and helped make things right — the only staff member who seemed genuinely kind and attentive. However, when the second drink was fixed, it came back in a white cup covered in stains and splashes. The coffee tasted bitter and unpleasant, and the cup was filled to the rim with no room to add cream or sugar. This was frustrating since I’d specifically asked for my coffee to be prepared at the front. Instead, I ended up making it myself at the back station.

What bothered me most was the inconsistent and sometimes unfriendly customer service. The barista behind the counter seemed selective in how she treated guests — giving plates and extra care to some while being dismissive to others. One of the most upsetting moments was seeing a disabled man politely ask for a to-go plate. Instead of helping or asking someone else to, she told him to “wave the woman down” when she came out of the kitchen. That was disappointing to witness.

When our food finally arrived (after our name was called for the third time), the croissant sandwiches were delicious — hot, fresh, and full of flavor with a great house sauce. The food was honestly the best part of the entire visit. However, again, the sandwiches weren’t labeled, so we had to open them to see which was which.

I also noticed some kitchen staff with long hair not wearing hairnets. As someone who’s worked in customer service and food service for over 20 years — and as a licensed cosmetologist trained in sanitation — I can say that proper food safety practices are important. Hairnets should be mandatory when preparing food.

Overall, the café felt understaffed and unorganized. The cashier was struggling, the counter worker was overwhelmed, and the kitchen staff seemed under pressure. The space is beautiful and has great potential, but the service and quality control need serious improvement.

Suggestions for improvement:
Serve all drinks from one order together
Label drinks and food items clearly
Ensure cups are clean before serving
Provide consistent, friendly customer service
Add more front-of-house staff to help during rush hours
Require name tags and hairnets for all employees
Improve organization and workflow

It’s disappointing because I’ve been a loyal Waterbean Coffee customer in Charlotte for years and have always had great experiences there. Unfortunately, this Gastonia location did not meet the same standard. The food was great, the drinks were mediocre, and the service was poor.

For such a beautiful and seemingly upscale place, I expected better. Customer service is everything, and I truly hope management takes steps to improve. I might give it another try in the future, but based on this visit, it was not the relaxing or enjoyable morning we had hoped for.

This was our 2nd trip to Waterbean. I ordered a pumpkin Stove Latte with whole milk. My wife asked if they could make the Snickerdoodle with Oat Milk and make it hot and they said they could. The Pumpkin Spice came out first. It tasted like hot milk. I couldn't tell there was any coffee in it and the "pumpkin spice" also tasted weird. They didn't tell us which drink they have is, so as we asked and they told us it was the Pumpkin Spice, my wife noticed that the barista was making a child drink. She said, "Of that's the Snickerdoodle, it's suppose to be hot with Oat Milk". (She is lactose intolerant). They said, "Oh. Hot? Do you want the cold foam on top? My wife said, "Is it made with Oat Milk?" They said, "No, but without the cold foam it's just white mocha, because we put the flavoring on top of the cold foam". So, she opted for a Pumpkin Spice Latte. I had not said anything about the fact that I didn't care for mine. When she got hers she said, "It's watery. I didn't even taste any coffee". I then ordered for "2 separate espresso shots" to add to our lattes. They brought me a double shot in one cup. Ok, so we split it and added it to our lattes. My wife said, "This tastes like muddy water out of an old boot". They just weren't good, no matter what we did. I really, really wanted to support them and I want them to be successful, but I can say that we won't be back. Makes me sad.  The place is beautiful and maybe their cocktails are good.
Amazing coffee and good food. Food took a bit to come out, but they were busy, so it's expected.

Everything was super good food and coffee ! Communication needs to be worked on . We waited 3 hours for our food to arrive. She kept coming back and forth asking what we ordered and on the 4th we got frustrated because people after us keep getting there food. Need more ppl in the kitchen or more communication

The place is pretty busy with being new and I understand the food may take some time due to working out kinks but the vibe, food, and coffee is truly exquisite! Definitely recommend and it’s a welcome addition to Gastonia!

This location is very nice of course but I have to say that the coffee is nothing special, I would pick Panera a Starbucks etc over this place any day.,. I feel horrible to have to say this but I have to be honest McDonald's frappes and coffee is even a hundred times better. All that we got were two frappes a bagel with cream cheese and a croissant and waited for 55 minutes and this was after the rush on Saturday morning we paid for our items at 11:56 and did not walk out the door until 12: 55. Yes the atmosphere is beautiful and you can tell that someone put money into the interior / exterior but that doesn't make the coffee or the food taste any better I did ask for a toasted bagel and all I got was a warm bagel. My husband got a Dubai croissant (chocolate croissant) he did like that.,.. we live in the Trenton Mill apartments right behind the coffee shop and probably will not go back... I do understand that they did just open 2 weeks ago and they are trying to get everything figured out but as far as the quality I'm not impressed and waiting an hour for a bagel and croissant seemed a little much.. especially that the rush was already over with.
Not to mention it was right at $30 for two frappes a bagel with cream cheese and a croissant. Great job on the decor!!

I would wait to visit. We waited over an hour and a half for food. Tasted decent but little to no communication on what to expect and only compensated us for one drink after I said something. People who got here long after us were served before us. Very frustrating

Took my mother to the grand opening last Saturday. Live music (piano) and ambiance were incredible! Menu options and decor were first class. Thank you for choosing West Gastonia. I will be a repeat customer.
Came yesterday between church services was very impressed.   Came this morning with wife and kids.  Wonderful breakfast and coffee.

Great coffee with multiple bean options!
Can’t wait to come back and try different things

Stopped by the grand opening of Waterbean Coffee in Gastonia — great turnout and tons of energy in the place. The building and interior are absolutely beautiful, with a clean and modern feel that really stands out. It did take about an hour to get our drinks (they were definitely slammed with the crowd), but the staff was friendly and working hard to keep up. The live piano was a nice touch, though it was a bit too loud to hold a conversation. Overall, a great addition to Gastonia and looking forward to coming back once things settle down!
Not sure why making my cappuccino required the use of a blow torch, but I'm intrigued. Great addition to the neighborhood.

I waited all week to get here and we were the first people to arrive. It has a great ambience, there's a piano in the corner, however I didn't get to take a picture of it yet; as well as the gold accentuated seats and accents. They have a private room that I believe you can rent that looks really well, also they had matcha lattes. It was delicious and I had the pumpkin white mocha latte hot, it was just as delicious and just for general purposes I ordered a ribeye sandwich. I prefer ribeye with onion and mayo but this had provolone cheese and some type of glaze on it. It wasn't nasty it was different than what I expected but it was well done and it even looked very good. Abigail, Aniston, Elena, and Amaya (hope I spelled their names correctly) we're hospitable, kind, audible and professional. I recommend to come here early morning if you pass by here on your way to work or even on your way home. It has a great ambience to it, I love the music they were playing, overall refreshing. Thank you for joining the community.

raw_data.address: 618 W Franklin Blvd Suite D, Gastonia, NC 28052
raw_data.name: Waterbean Coffee Exquisite
